nodes.description: 2002年8月，记者在黎巴嫩贝卡谷地Ras al-Ein村采访真主党派系领导人Hussayn al-Mussawi
nodes.support_text: I visited Ras al-Ein this summer to interview the leader of a Hezbollah faction, a man named Hussayn al-Mussawi, who, twenty years ago, was involved in kidnapping Americans.

nodes.description: 1982年真主党由穆罕默德·侯赛因·法德尔拉赫领导成立，成为黎巴嫩主要武装组织
nodes.support_text: Hezbollah was formed, in 1982, by a group of young, dispossessed Shiites who coalesced around a cleric and poet named Muhammad Hussayn Fadlallah.

nodes.description: 1983年10月真主党发动同步自杀式袭击，摧毁美国驻黎巴嫩海军陆战队基地和法国维和部队公寓
nodes.support_text: The organization virtually invented the multipronged terror attack when, early on the morning of October 23, 1983, it synchronized the suicide bombings, in Beirut, of the United States Marine barracks and an apartment building housing a contingent of French peacekeepers.

nodes.description: 1985年真主党劫持TW-Airways航班，导致一名美国海军潜水员被杀害
nodes.support_text: It is thought that Ras al-Ein is where William Buckley, the Beirut station chief of the Central Intelligence Agency, was held for a time before he was killed by Hezbollah, in 1985.

nodes.description: 1991年黎巴嫩内战结束，真主党名义上解除武装，但实际保留武器
nodes.support_text: A crucial event, though, was Israel’s invasion of Lebanon in June of 1982... Nominally, Lebanon is governed from Beirut by an administration whose senior portfolios have been carefully divided among the country’s various religious factions... The Syrians also allowed Hezbollah to maintain its arsenal, and even to expand it, in the interest of fighting Israel as Syria’s proxy.

nodes.description: 1994年阿根廷布宜诺斯艾利斯犹太社区中心遭自杀式爆炸袭击，真主党被指控
nodes.support_text: Hezbollah has served as a role model for terror groups around the world; Magnus Ranstorp, the director of the Centre for the Study of Terrorism and Political Violence, at the University of St. Andrews, in Scotland, says that Al Qaeda learned the value of choreographed violence from Hezbollah.

nodes.description: 1996年沙特khobar基地遭袭击，19名美军士兵死亡，真主党被怀疑参与
nodes.support_text: Magnus Ranstorp... says that Al Qaeda learned the value of choreographed violence from Hezbollah.

nodes.description: 2000年以色列从南黎巴嫩撤军，真主党成为该地区唯一主要武装力量
nodes.support_text: And, two years ago, it became the first military force, guerrilla or otherwise, to drive Israel out of Arab territory when Prime Minister Ehud Barak withdrew his forces from South Lebanon.

nodes.description: 2002年记者再次访问Ras al-Ein，揭露真主党通过伊朗获得资金和武器支持
nodes.support_text: Hezbollah has an annual budget of more than a hundred million dollars, which is supplied by the Iranian government directly and by a complex system of finance cells scattered around the world, from Bangkok and Paraguay to Michigan and North Carolina.

nodes.description: 2003年伊朗革命卫队参与真主党在贝卡谷地的秘密训练营地建设
nodes.support_text: The Syrians also allowed Hezbollah to control the Shiite ghettos of southern Beirut, much of the Bekaa Valley, and most of South Lebanon, along the border with Israel.

nodes.description: 2004年以色列海军截获真主党运输50吨伊朗武器的‘卡里内A号’货船
nodes.support_text: The yellow flag of Hezbollah could be seen everywhere; across the top is a quotation from the Koran, from which Hezbollah took its name-‘Verily the party of God shall be victorious’-and at the center is an AK-47 in silhouette, in the hand of the Shiite martyr Husayn, a cousin of the Prophet Muhammad.

nodes.description: 2005年真主党与哈马斯合作，策划对以色列进行‘巨弹’袭击
nodes.support_text: Hezbollah has served as a role model for terror groups around the world; Magnus Ranstorp... says that Al Qaeda learned the value of choreographed violence from Hezbollah.

nodes.description: 2018年真主党在黎巴嫩议会获得11个席位，实际控制贝卡谷地及南黎巴嫩
nodes.support_text: Hezbollah has served as a role model for terror groups around the world; Magnus Ranstorp... says that Al Qaeda learned the value of choreographed violence from Hezbollah.

edges.support_text: Hezbollah was formed, in 1982, by a group of young, dispossessed Shiites who coalesced around a cleric and poet named Muhammad Hussayn Fadlallah.
It is thought that Ras al-Ein is where William Buckley, the Beirut station chief of the Central Intelligence Agency, was held for a time before he was killed by Hezbollah, in 1985.

A crucial event, though, was Israel’s invasion of Lebanon in June of 1982... The Syrians also allowed Hezbollah to maintain its arsenal, and even to expand it, in the interest of fighting Israel as Syria’s proxy.
And, two years ago, it became the first military force, guerrilla or otherwise, to drive Israel out of Arab territory when Prime Minister Ehud Barak withdrew his forces from South Lebanon.
I visited Ras al-Ein this summer to interview the leader of a Hezbollah faction, a man named Hussayn al-Mussawi, who, twenty years ago, was involved in kidnapping Americans.
The Syrians also allowed Hezbollah to control the Shiite ghettos of southern Beirut, much of the Bekaa Valley, and most of South Lebanon, along the border with Israel.

The yellow flag of Hezbollah could be seen everywhere; across the top is a quotation from the Koran, from which Hezbollah took its name-‘Verily the party of God shall be victorious’-and at the center is an AK-47 in silhouette, in the hand of the Shiite martyr Husayn, a cousin of the Prophet Muhammad.
Hezbollah has served as a role model for terror groups around the world; Magnus Ranstorp... says that Al Qaeda learned the value of choreographed violence from Hezbollah.
